outline.title: Strategic Position Analysis
outline.summary: Title slide introducing the strategic position analysis for response to Letter of Demand with 48-hour deadline in Case 2025-137857.

outline.title: Peter's Third Application Dismissed - Perfect Record of Failures
outline.summary: Application 3 (Contact Interdict) dismissed by court on 25 November 2025, representing Peter's third consecutive unsuccessful application and establishing pattern of frivolous litigation.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/revstream1/slide_images/legal_victory.png - Image 1 explicitly shows a 'Successful Court Dismissal' which directly relates to the slide content about Application 3 being dismissed.

outline.title: Legal Counsel Clarified - Strategic Implications Revealed
outline.summary: Legal representation identified: Elliott Attorneys represents Peter & Rynette, Pottas Attorneys represents Jacqueline & Daniel. Rynette's claim of being 'not a party' undermined by sharing counsel with applicant Peter.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/revstream1/slide_images/legal_representation.png - Image 2 illustrates 'Defense Counsel' and 'Plaintiff Counsel' with their respective 'Clients', which is highly relevant to the slide discussing the clarification of legal representation and the strategic contradiction of shared counsel.

outline.title: Five Key Strengths Position Jax & Dan for Successful Defense
outline.summary: Application 3 dismissal, strong evidence (5 of 7 allegations), qualified privilege protection, ongoing interdict violations, and Elliott's internal contradiction provide strategic advantages.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/revstream1/slide_images/strategic_strengths.png - Image 3, titled 'COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES: KEY STRENGTHS IN LEGAL PRACTICE', visually represents the five key strengths listed in the slide content.

outline.title: Critical Response Actions Within 48 Hours of Letter Receipt
outline.summary: Four immediate actions required: respond to Letter of Demand, assert qualified privilege, compile evidence dossier, and consult with Pottas Attorneys on defamation defense strategy.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/revstream1/slide_images/strategic_action.png - Image 5 shows a process flow with time-sensitive steps (Discovery, Strategy, Motion, Resolution), which aligns well with the slide's focus on four immediate, time-bound actions required within a 48-hour deadline.

outline.title: Seven Allegations Analyzed - Five Supported by Strong Evidence
outline.summary: Evidence strength assessment table showing 5 allegations with STRONG evidence, 2 with MEDIUM/WEAK evidence, all defensible through qualified privilege and truth defense.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/revstream1/slide_images/evidence_strength.png - Image 4 is a 'Legal Analytical Assessment: Evidence Strength' chart, which is a perfect visual representation for the slide content detailing the evidence strength for seven different allegations.

outline.title: Three-Tier Response Strategy for Maximum Legal Protection
outline.summary: Immediate response (48 hours), short-term actions (1 week), and medium-term strategy (1 month) for comprehensive legal defense and strategic positioning.

outline.title: Strong Position Supported by Evidence, Court Victories, and Strategic Advantages
outline.summary: Summary of position with immediate priority to respond to Letter of Demand, strategic advantage from Elliott's contradiction, and recommended evidence-based defense approach.
